front.title: Deployment and Use of the Domain Name System(DNS) in Deep Space

abstract.t: Deep space communications involve long delays (e.g., Earth to Mars has one-way delays 4-24 minutes) and intermittent communications, mainly because of orbital dynamics. This document lists operational methods to enable local DNS name resolving on celestial body networks such that there are no real-time query and response flow to the authoritative name servers on (Earth) Internet.
